means: 笨拙的工人( tinker的名词复数 )
能做各种小修小补的人
做焊锅匠( tinker的第三人称单数 )

sentence.Network_en: Thin metal tins think tinkers kings.
sentence.Network_cn: 薄薄的金属罐把补锅匠当成国王.

sentence.Network_en: He tinkers with old radios a hobby.
sentence.Network_cn: 他把修理旧收音机当成嗜好.

sentence.Network_en: Created by Goblin tinkers, the Penguins amuse their owners by squeaking whenever activated.
sentence.Network_cn: 他们是地精发明的, 使用者只要打开它,它就可以者“吱吱咕咕”地叫.

list.exp: 寒夜常梦见，你鹤发童颜
list.abs: 馋死了，哪家酸菜鱼好次呀 ... Goblin Tinker (寒夜常梦见，你鹤发童颜。。。) 2012-12-15 21:14:30 JIE 杰 2012-12-19 15:41:55.

entry.def: If you tinker with something, you make some small changes to it, in an attempt to improve it or repair it.

example.ex: Instead of the Government admitting its error, it just tinkered with the problem...
example.tran: 政府没有承认错误，只是敷衍了事地处理问题。

entry.def: In former times, a tinker was a person who did not have a fixed home, but travelled from place to place mending metal pots and doing other small repair jobs.

entry.tran: (尤指爱尔兰裔的)流浪者，吉卜赛人
entry.def: Some people refer to any traveller or gipsy, especially one who is Irish, as a tinker .

auth_sentence.content: Arriving at the church, he found it filled with a whole tribe of tinkers.
auth_sentence.res_content: Arriving at the church, he found it filled with a whole tribe of tinkers.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Arriving at the church, he found it filled with a whole tribe of tinkers.

auth_sentence.content: The ladders clattered in the yard, pulled out of sight for the night in case they'd be a temptation for the tinkers.

auth_sentence.content: She drove past the tinkers at the Cross, the children in their rags running about, feet bare, heads cropped.
